title: Greatest Prime Divisor of Polynomial Products
overview: Let f ∈ ℤ[x] be irreducible of degree d ≥ 2. Let F_f(n) = greatest prime dividing ∏_{m=1}^n f(m). Is F_f(n) ≫ n^{1+c} for some c > 0? Or even ≫ n^d?
conclusion: OPEN - Best known: F_f(n) ≫ n exp((log n)^c) (Tenenbaum 1990). Earlier: n log n (Nagell-Ricci 1922), n(log n)^{log log log n} (Erdős 1952). The polynomial growth conjectures (n^{1+c} or n^d) remain unproved.
references: Nagell-Ricci (1922) - Initial bound n log n
Tenenbaum (1990) - Current best: n exp((log n)^c)
